labels.analysis: The MCP Server is specifically designed for managing and interacting with Sitecore instances, a popular content management system (CMS). It provides a comprehensive suite of tools for querying, managing items, handling security, managing presentations, indexing content, and logging. The tools cover a wide range of functionalities including item operations (creation, editing, deletion), security management (user and role management, access control), presentation management (layout, renderings, placeholder settings), indexing (search index management, item indexing), and logging. The server leverages GraphQL, Item Service API, and PowerShell integration to enable efficient content management and automation.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Content Management" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around managing content within a CMS (Sitecore). Secondary labels "API Integration" and "Database Operations" are selected because the server heavily relies on APIs for interaction and manages database items extensively. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Sitecore Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Antonytm/mcp-sitecore-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable seamless interaction with Sitecore instances by providing a comprehensive set of tools for querying, managing items, security, presentation, indexing, and logging. Facilitate efficient content management and automation through GraphQL, Item Service API, and PowerShell integration. Optimize AI agent workflows by selectively enabling necessary tools for faster and cost-effective operations.

tools.description: Deploy Server Sitecore Server @Antonytm/mcp-sitecore-server Try in Playground

tools.description: Introspection Sitecore GraphQL edge schema, use this tool before doing a query to get the schema information if you do not have it available as a resource already.

tools.name: indexing-initialize-search-index
tools.description: Initialize one or more Sitecore search indexes. If no name is provided, all indexes will be initialized.

tools.name: indexing-get-search-index
tools.description: Get information about Sitecore search indexes. Can filter by name, database, running status, or corrupted status.

tools.name: indexing-find-item
tools.description: Finds items using the Sitecore Content Search API. Date format should be in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2023-10-01T00:00:00Z').

tools.name: indexing-resume-search-index
tools.description: Resume one or more Sitecore search indexes. If no name is provided, all paused indexes will be resumed.

tools.name: indexing-suspend-search-index
tools.description: Suspend one or more Sitecore search indexes. If no name is provided, all running indexes will be suspended.

tools.name: indexing-stop-search-index
tools.description: Stop one or more Sitecore search indexes. If no name is provided, all running indexes will be stopped.

tools.name: indexing-initialize-search-index-item-by-id
tools.description: Rebuilds the index for a given tree with the specified root item by id and index name. Supports wildcard filtering for the index name.

tools.name: indexing-initialize-search-index-item-by-path
tools.description: Rebuilds the index for a given tree with the specified root item by path and index name. Supports wildcard filtering for the index name.

tools.name: indexing-remove-search-index-item-by-id
tools.description: Removes the item with the specified ID from the search index. Supports wildcard filtering for the index name.

tools.name: indexing-remove-search-index-item-by-path
tools.description: Removes the item with the specified path from the search index. Supports wildcard filtering for the index name.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Antonytm/mcp-sitecore-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
